definition: the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guo

sentences.english: The Chu general Zhuang Jiao entered the region from the upper Yangtze River and set himself up as "King of Dian".
sentences.chinese: 楚國的將軍莊郊從長江上游來到這裏自稱滇王。

sentences.english: Chu and Qi were only able to compete with them.
sentences.chinese: 當時只有楚國和齊國能與之抗衡。

sentences.english: Then, Qin government intends to fight on the state of Chu.
sentences.chinese: 接着，秦王政就打算去打楚國。

sentences.english: Chu has a well-known archery bear experts called drainage sub.
sentences.chinese: 楚國有一位著名的射箭能手名叫熊渠子。

sentences.english: The Suipian offered new evidence for study calendar of Chu state.
sentences.chinese: 《日書》“歲篇”爲楚國曆法研究提供了新證據。

sentences.english: Chu's once in ChuShan and found a piece of jade called equipments.
sentences.chinese: 楚國人和氏有一次在楚山中發現一塊叫做璞的玉石。

sentences.english: A man from the state of Chu wanted to sell a precious pearl in the state of Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 有個楚國人想在鄭國出售一顆珍貴的珍珠。

sentences.english: Sitting in the chariot was the great King of Chu.
sentences.chinese: 坐在車上的是偉大的楚國國君。

sentences.english: There is a sacrifice to the chu and rewarded MenKe a pot of wine.
sentences.chinese: 楚國有個祭祀的人，賞給門客一壺酒。

sentences.english: On the way to the State of Chu, Confucius saw an old man catching cicada in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 孔子到楚國去，在路上遇見一位在林中捕蟬的老先生。

sentences.english: Pre-Qin era, Chu has been the integration of all ethnic groups in southern culture.
sentences.chinese: 先秦時代，楚國已融合了南方各族文化。

sentences.english: Finally, chu destroyed by the state of qin.
sentences.chinese: 終於，楚國被秦國滅掉了。

sentences.english: But I really have a premonition that Chu is facing GREat danger.
sentences.chinese: 大臣莊辛預見到楚國會發生危險。

sentences.english: A man of the state of Zheng bought the casket and gave him back the pearl.
sentences.chinese: 有個楚國人想在鄭國出售一顆珍貴的珍珠。

sentences.english: The current cold weather, it is better first went to the south of Wei and Chu Shou Fu .
sentences.chinese: 目前天冷，不如先去收服南方的魏國和楚國。

sentences.english: Chu people of peril and suffering, pain Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 楚國的危亡和百姓的痛苦，屈原痛不欲生。

definition: Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Qi state of Western Zhou and the Warring states (1122-265 BC), centered in Shandong
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
vassal state
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
monarch

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
King Huai of Chu (reigned 328-299 BC)/later King Huai of Chu (reigned 208-205 BC)
Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]
